KF-PLS: Streaming PLS with Kalman-style updates

FrÃ©dÃ©ric Bertrand

Cedric, Cnam, Paris
frederic.bertrand@lecnam.net

2025-11-13

Source: vignettes/kf-pls.Rmd
kf-pls.Rmd
library(bigPLSR)
set.seed(1)

Idea

We maintain exponentially-weighted cross-products ğ‚xxâ†Î»ğ‚xx+ğ—bâŠ¤ğ—b+qğˆ,ğ‚xyâ†Î»ğ‚xy+ğ—bâŠ¤ğ˜b, \mathbf{C}_{xx} \leftarrow \lambda\,\mathbf{C}_{xx} + \mathbf{X}_b^\top\mathbf{X}_b + q\,\mathbf{I},\qquad \mathbf{C}_{xy} \leftarrow \lambda\,\mathbf{C}_{xy} + \mathbf{X}_b^\top\mathbf{Y}_b, over mini-batches bb of rows, where 0<Î»â‰¤10<\lambda\le 1 is a forgetting factor and qâ‰¥0q\ge 0 a small process-noise ridge. At any time we extract latent components via SIMPLS on (ğ‚xx,ğ‚xy)(\mathbf{C}_{xx},\mathbf{C}_{xy}). This is stable, fast, and matches a Kalman-style tracking of slowly varying covariance structure.

API 

fit <- pls_fit(X, Y, ncomp = 3,
               backend   = "arma"  # or "bigmem"
               ,algorithm = "kf_pls",
               scores    = "r",
               tol = 1e-8,
               # tuning:
               # options(bigPLSR.kf.lambda = 0.995,
               #         bigPLSR.kf.q_proc = 1e-6)
)

On bigmem, cross-products are streamed in row chunks; scores ğ“\mathbf{T} are produced via the packageâ€™s chunked score kernel.

Notes

  • Î»â†’1\lambda\to 1 and qâ†’0q\to 0 recovers batch SIMPLS.
  • Smaller Î»\lambda emphasizes recent batches (concept drift).
  • qq stabilizes ill-conditioned ğ‚xx\mathbf{C}_{xx} on very high-dimensional data.
